descriptionHtml:
[color=green][size=4][b]I. About[/b][/size][/color]
From the guy that brought you the  [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=17400]ENB Customizer[/url] now comes a truly realistic and atmospheric ENB preset.

[b]Features[/b]
- Darker and warmer nights (no custom lighting needed, just pure enb tweaking).
- Darker caves (thanks to  [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12454]Dark Dungeons for ENB[/url] by mindflux).
- Darker shadows.
- Realistic sun and sunglare (thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=866]ReAL Sun - insane0h Realistic Sunglare[/url] by sval).
- Overall image adjustments (thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=866]IMAGINATOR[/url] by MyGoodEye and Gopher).
- Bright and realistic days (not too much saturated, not too faded either).
- Perfect lighting from fireplaces and torches (not too faded so you can see at night using a torch and not too bright looking like some car\'s headlights).
- Running on latest version of enb (v.113).
- Perfect balance between ultra sharp \'painted\' image and blurry cinematic image.
- No annoying DOF (at lease for me).
- No film grain nor exagerated bloom for a realistic experience.

*Some features you dont like? (too dark, too bright, too bloomy, no letterbox, too saturated, too sharp, no dof, no film grain, etc, etc, etc). No problem. Use my [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=17400]ENB Customizer[/url] and make it to your tastes.

[color=green][size=4][b]II. Installation[/b][/size][/color]
1. Go to [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0113.htm]ENBSeries website[/url] and download that archive. Extract only the WrapperVersion -> d3d9.dll file into your Skyrim\'s root folder.
2. Extract the content of Enhanced Motion Picture ENB archive into Skyrim\'s root folder and overwrite everything.
3. Run the game and summon Imaginator helper to make it look like in my pictures. (use Contrast_Decrease_10 x 2 times and Saturation_Increase_10 x 2 times).


[color=green][size=4][b]III. Quick preview[/b][/size][/color]

[color=red][b]Endorse if you like it! Thanks.[/b][/color]
Dorian G.
